newsitem.title: CANADA: Royal Bank Canada sees lower '97 credit loss.
newsitem.headline: Royal Bank Canada sees lower '97 credit loss.

text.p: Royal Bank of Canada said on Wednesday that its provision for credit losses was C$440 million in 1996, down C$140 million from a year earlier and that it expected a lower 1997 loss provision.

"The bank expects its provision for credit losses in 1997 to be lower than this year's C$440 million level," Royal Bank said in its earnings statement. Net impaired loans dropped 54 percent to C$524 million in 1996, reflecting the resolution of a number of accounts during the year. As a percentage of total loans and bankers' acceptances, net impaired loans improved to 0.4 percent in 1996 from 0.9 percent in 1995.
